channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chipotle launches summer promotion, which will see it giving out $1 million in free burritos
item.description: Also returning is the Chipotle card, which brings free burritos for a year.

item.title: EU fines Delivery Hero and Glovo $376 million for running a food delivery cartel
item.description: The EU found Delivery Hero and its Spanish unit Glovo stifled competition in Europe’s food delivery sector by sharing commercially sensitive informati...

item.title: What to Know About the Russia-Ukraine Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: The two sides met on Monday in Istanbul, but expectations for a breakthrough were low.

item.title: The 3 best ways new college graduates can expand their professional networks, according to a LinkedIn career expert
item.description: Many recent graduates are feeling lost professionally as they struggle to find a job.

item.title: Companies Rely on Delaware Courts. Lawyers Reap Huge Fees There.
item.description: A new study found that courts in the state, where many big companies reside, often cleared big payouts to lawyers. It may further embolden the state’s...

item.title: Elon Musk is distancing himself from Trump: ‘I don’t want to take responsibility for everything’
item.description: Just about 48 hours after Musk left the government, his preferred pick to run NASA was withdrawn by the White House.

item.title: In Russia Airfield Attacks, Ukraine Aims for Strategic and Symbolic Blow
item.description: While the full extent of the damage is still unknown, the operation shows how Kyiv has been able to adapt and evolve over the war using drones.

item.title: Poland’s Presidential Election Result Highlights Trump-Europe Divide
item.description: The country’s government is centrist, with deep ties to Brussels. Its new president is a Trump-backed nationalist. That reflects a broader struggle.

item.title: Attack in Boulder, Colorado, Investigated as Act of Terrorism: What to Know

item.title: This year’s new female Fortune 500 CEOs have one thing in common
item.description: Women run 11% of companies on 2025's Fortune 500.

item.title: What imports the U.S. relies on most from every country.
item.description: The item from each country that makes up the largest American import share.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia Met for 2nd Round of Talks as Attacks Escalate
item.description: After more than three years of war, Moscow and Kyiv engaged in direct discussions to end the fighting.
